result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle L Maier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Amanda Riek. re: completion of representation
Defendant's probation revoked- sentenced to county jail/hoc on 9-18-18; unpaid supervision fees of $300
filed by attorney Nicholas John Rifelj.

11:21 a.m., Cases called: 14CF472, 15CF426, 18CF75 & 15CF20, Defendant Michelle L Maier in court, in custody with attorney Nicholas John Rifelj.  Maura O'Connell Melka appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties received revocation paperwork, no changes. In 18CF75 - Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled guilty to counts 1&2. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Sentence withheld, 2 years probation. Conditions: No contact with Historic, Portage, WI, except as allowed by agent. No violent contact with anyone. Maintain absolute sobriety. Submit DNA sample. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. $443, $243 costs. Counts 3&4 read in and dismissed. In revocation cases, Court imposed 1 year jail each case, concurrent with each other. Huber granted under jail rules, inclusive of treatment. Remaining costs converted to civil judgment. 265 days jail credit each case. 11:49 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 18, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Michelle L Maier in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 14CF472, 15CF426, & 17CF345. In 15CF426 Not guilty by reason of insanity or defect withdrawn, court granted. Rights/Elements. Defendant pled no contest to Ct. 5 of 15CF426. Court found guilty. Judgment was entered. Cts. 1-4 Dismissed. 17CF345 Dismissed. In 14CF472 Ct.1 and 15CF426 Ct. 5 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years, concurrent to current probation. Conditions of probation include in both cases: AODA and comply with any treatment recommended. Submit DNA sample. $518.00 costs each case. Bond on hand to be applied towards costs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 25, 2017 at 09:30 am.
